alert.note: Alert for Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 5:33PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Wilkes County through 615 PM EDT... At 533 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Maple Springs, or near Wilbar, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... North Wilkesboro... Wilkesboro... Wilbar... Mc Grady... Mulberry... Wilkesboro Reservoir... and Buck. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
